intro: Hieracium laxum, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and yellow or orange flowers. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and can form dense colonies. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough texture, while its flowers are arranged in a flat-topped cluster. Hieracium laxum is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
